Description: WDVA IS PROPOSING PROVIDING A $3,000 TOTAL RECRUITMENT INCENTIVE FOR NEW, FULL-TIME, PERMANENT NAC AND NAC LEADS AT THE HOME.  A $3,000 RETENTION INCENTIVE PAYMENT WOULD BE PROVIDED TO EXISTING, FULL-TIME, PERMENANT STAFF AT THE HOME WHO HAVE WORKED AT LEAST ONE CALENDAR YEAR AS A NAC OR NAC LEAD AND HAVE COMPLETED AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE DEVELOPMENT EVALUATION.  THE INCENTIVE WOULD BE REQUIRED TO BE PAID BACK IN FULL IF THE EMPLOYEE RESIGNS OR IS SEPARATED FROM EMPLOYMENT WITHIN ONE YEAR OF THE DATE OF RECEIPT OF THE RETENTION BONUS. WALLAWALLA $138,400

SIGNING BONUSES OF FIVE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR RN AND LPN AND THREE THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR CNA.  BONUS PER SHIFT.  SIGN ON INCENTIVE BONUSES PAID TO NURSING STAFF AT THE VIRGLNIA VETERANS CARE CENTER WOULD BE BE PAID OVER THE FIRST YEAR OF EMPLOYMENT IN INSTALLMENTS. LNSTALLMENTS WILL BE PAID AFTER THREE, SIX AND TWELVE MONTHS OF EMPLOYMENT. LNCENTIVES PAID FOR ADDITIONAL SHIFTS WORKED ARE VERIFIED BY THE SHIFT SUPERVISOR AND AGAINST THE ORIGINAL WORK SCHEDULE TO INSURE THE COMPENSATION IS DUE AND THAT THE SHIFT WAS COMPLETED. EMPLOYEES ARE NOTIFIED THAT THEY MUST COMPLETE THE ENTIRE ADDITIONAL SHIFT TO RECEIVE THE INCENTIVE.  IF AN  EMPLOYEE ARRIVES LATE OR LEAVES BEFORE THE SHIFT ENDS, THEY ARE INELIGIBLE FOR COMPENSATION. $245,000

PROVIDE TUITION ASSISTANCE PAYMENTS FOR STAFF THAT ARE ATTENDING SCHOOL OR WOULD LIKE TO ATTEND SCHOOL.  $50,000

THE RECRUITMENT BONUS WILL ALLOW FOR EL PASO SVH TO RECRUIT NEW STAFF, BUT ALSO KEEP THE STAFF AT EL PASO SVH  FOR AT LEAST A YEAR TO RECEIVE THE ENTIRE BONUS. THE FIRST PAYMENT OF 25% WILL BE MADE WITHIN 90 DAYS FROM THE START OF THEIR EMPLOYMENT. THE SUBSEQUENT PAYMENTS OF 25% WILL BE MADE UPON THE COMPLETION OF 6 MONTHS, 9 MONTHS AND AT THE COMPLETION OF ONE YEAR (12 FULL MONTHS) OF EMPLOYMENT. THIS WILL ENSURE THAT AN EMPLOYEE WILL STAY EMPLOYED WITH EL PASO AN ENTIRE YEAR BEFORE THEY RECEIVE THE ENTIRE BONUS. EMPLOYEES WILL SIGN A RECRUITMENT SIGN-ON BONUS AGREEMENT (APPENDIX B) BEFORE ANY MONIES ARE PAID TO THE NEW EMPLOYEE. $88,000
THE REFERRAL BONUS IS TO REWARD THOSE EMPLOYEES WHO ARE MAKING REFERRALS AND BRINGING GOOD EMPLOYEES TO EL PASO. THIS BONUS WILL BE PAID TO THE EMPLOYEE WHO MADE THE REFERRAL ON A MONTHLY BASIS FOR AN ENTIRE YEAR AS LONG AS THE NEW EMPLOYEE STAYS AT THE FACILITY. IT WILL BE PAID OUT IN $100.00 INCREMENTS OVER A 12-MONTH TIMEFRAME. EMPLOYEES WILL SIGN A REFERRAL BONUS AGREEMENT BEFORE ANY MONIES ARE PAID. $9,600
THE EMPLOYEE RETENTION BONUS WILL REWARD EMPLOYEES WHO HAVE SHOWN COMMITMENT TO TVSI AT WATKINS-LOGAN OVER THE PAST YEAR AND ENCOURAGE EMPLOYEES TO CONTINUE TO WORK FOR TVSI AT AMBROSIO GUILLEN. ANY NURSING EMPLOYEE WHO HAS OVER A YEAR OF SERVICE WITH TVSI AT WATKINS- LOGAN AS OF OCTOBER 1, 2021 WILL BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE AN ANNUAL BONUS PAID OUT IN 25% QUARTERLY INCREMENTS OVER A 12-MONTH TIMEFRAME. THE DETERMINATION OF WHICH CERTIFIED NURSING. $114,200
ASSISTANTS, LICENSED PRACTICAL NURSES, AND REGISTERED NURSES RECEIVE THIS BONUS WILL BE AT THE DISCRETION OF THE TVSI. EMPLOYEES WILL SIGN A RETENTION BONUS AGREEMENT BEFORE ANY MONIES ARE PAID. TOTAL COST $211,600

GRANT MONEY REQUESTED TO ATTAIN, RETAIN, AND ENGAGE CLINICAL STAFF. THE FOLLOWING THREE (3) ELEMENTS TARGET THE NURSING SHORTAGE IN THE VETERAN HOMES.
THE GRANT MONEY IS INTENDED TO BE USED IN 2022 TO STABILIZE SVH THROUGH FILLING VACANT POSITIONS AND RETENTION CLINICAL STAFF. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO FOCUS ON RESILIENCE TRAINING WITH THE INTENTION TO ENGAGE STAFF, FURTHER SUPPORTING RETENTION EFFORTS.  SIGN-ON BONUS $33,000; STAY BONUS $155,500, GROWTH PATHWAYS $7,500

EMPLOYEE WILL RECEIVE THE INCENTIVE OVER THE COURSE OF THREE (3) YEARS. EMPLOYEE WILL RECEIVE TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT (25%) DURING YEAR ONE (1), TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT (25%) DURING YEAR TWO (2) AND FIFTY PERCENT (50%) DURING YEAR THREE (3). PROVIDING THE LARGEST, FIFTY PERCENT (50%) PAYMENT, DURING THE THIRD YEAR WILL INCENTIVIZE EMPLOYEES TO MAINTAIN FULL-TIME STATUS AT MURFREESBOROTENNESSEE STATE VETERANS' HOMES FOR REQUIRED PERIOD. $211,645.66

HIRE1 RN TO FILL OUR ONLY OPEN NURSE POSITION GIVE A SIGN-ON INCENTIVE OF $3200.  PLANS ARE TO GIVE OUR 4 NEW LPN SCHOLARSHIP GRADUATES INCENTIVE BONUSES OF $2200 EACH FOR A HIRING TOTAL OF $8,800.  WE HOPE TO HIRE AT LEAST 2 CNAS AND THEY WILL BE GIVEN $750 EACH AS A SIGN-ON BONUS FOR A TOTAL OF $1500.  WE JUST HIRED ONE HOMEMAKER AND PLANS ARE TO PROVIDE HER WITH A $500 SIGN-ON INCENTIVE.  WE ALSO PLAN ON HIRING 12 ADDITIONAL HOMEMAKERS AND THEY EACH WOULD BE ELIGIBLE FOR $500 SIGN-ON INCENTIVES AS NON-TRAINED AIDES.  THE NEW HOMEMAKERS WILL FILL THE 9 CURRENTLY OPEN POSITIONS AND 3 OF THE 4 POSITIONS OUR NEW LPNS WILL LEAVE OPEN. WE’VE ALREADY REPLACED 1 CNA POSITION FOR OUR LPN ALREADY WORKING ON THE FLOOR.  THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF SIGN-ON FOR AIDES IS PROJECTED TO BE $6000.  INCENTIVES FOR NURSES ARE PAYABLE ONE-HALF AT START OF EMPLOYMENT. SECOND HALF PAYABLE IS AFTER 6 MONTHS OF EMPLOYMENT AND SATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE REVIEWS AT THE 3RD AND 6TH MONTH WORK ANNIVERSARY. CNAS ARE PAID THEIR FULL INCENTIVE AFTER COMPLETION OF 6 MONTHS OF EMPLOYMENT AND SATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE REVIEWS AT 3RD AND 6TH MONTH. HOMEMAKERS ARE PAID THEIR FULL INCENTIVE AFTER SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THEIR CNA TRAINING, 6 MONTHS OF EMPLOYMENT, AND SATISFACTORY PERFORMANCE REVIEW AT THE 3RD AND 6TH MONTH.  NURSING STAFF ARE REQUIRED TO WORK AT LEAST 18 MONTHS OR ARE OBLIGATED, THROUGH CONTRACT, TO REPAY ANY INCENTIVE ON A PRO-RATA BASIS. ESTIMATED TOTAL SIGN-ON INCENTIVES ARE $19,500. VA PORTION WOULD BE $9,750.  TOTAL $72,412.36

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF 38 U.S.C. 1744, THIS PART SETS FORTH THE MECHANISM FOR A STATE TO OBTAIN PAYMENTS TO ASSIST A STATE VETERANS HOME (SVH) IN THE HIRING AND RETENTION OF NURSES FOR THE PURPOSE OF REDUCING NURSING SHORTAGES AT THAT SVH. IT IS A GRANT PROGRAM TO PROVIDE FUNDING ASSISTANCE FOR NO MORE THAN 3 YEARS THAT IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE SEQUENTIAL FOR USE OF HIRING AND RETENTION OF NURSES IN A STATE VETERANS HOME. NURSES CAN BE A REGISTERED NURSE, LICENSED PRACTICAL NURSE OR A CERTIFIED NURSE ASSISTANT.  THE SVH MUST DEMONSTRATE BY APPLICATION OF A NURSING SHORTAGE THAT IS DOCUMENTED BY CREDIBLE EVIDENCE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SVH RECORDS SHOWING NURSING VACANCIES, SVH RECORDS SHOWING NURSE OVERTIME USE, AND REPORTS DOCUMENTING THAT NURSES ARE DIFFICULT TO HIRE IN THE LOCAL AREA AND DIFFICULT TO RETAIN AS EMPLOYEES AT THE SVH. THE SVH MUST DEMONSTRATE THAT IT HAS AN EMPLOYEE INCENTIVE PROGRAM THAT CAN BE PUT INTO PLACE ON 10-1 OF THE FISCAL YEAR. PAYMENTS MAY NOT EXCEED 50 PERCENT OF THE COST OF THE EMPLOYEE INCENTIVE PROGRAM FOR THAT FISCAL YEAR AND MAY NOT EXCEED 2 PERCENT OF THE AMOUNT OF THE TOTAL PER DIEM PAYMENTS ESTIMATED BY VA TO BE MADE UNDER 38 U.S.C. 1741 TO THE STATE FOR THAT SVH DURING THAT FISCAL YEAR FOR ADULT DAY HEALTH CARE, DOMICILIARY CARE, HOSPITAL CARE, AND NURSING HOME CARE.

A TOTAL OF $515,000 WAS REQUESTED FOR THE SEVEN STATE VETERAN HOMES IN OKLAHOMA.  REQUEST WAS MADE UNDER FOUR CATEGORIES: TUITION ASSISTANCE $125,000; LICENSURE REIMBURSEMENT $15,000; STUDENT LOAN REPAYMENT PROGRAM $300,000 AND INCENTIVE FOR ADVANCED LICENSURE $75,000.  OF THE $515,000 HALF THE GRANT WILL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE STATE VETERAN HOMES OR $257,500. BREAKOUT FOR THE SVH IS AS FOLLOWS:  SULPHUR TUITION ASSISTANCE $11,000; LICENSURE REIMBURSEMENT $1,300; STUDENT LOAN REPAYMENT PROGRAM $26,400 AND INCENTIVE FOR ADVANCED LICENSURE $6,600. FOR A TOTAL OF $45,300.

A TOTAL OF $100,000 WAS REQUESTED FOR THE STATE VETERANS HOME IN NEW JERSEY.THE PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST WILL BE FOR OFFERING SIGN-ON BONUSES FOR RNS AND CNAS, IN ADDITION TO TUITION REIMBURSEMENT FOR LPNS AND CNAS TO BECOME RNS.

PART ONE OF MSVA’S EMPLOYEE INCENTIVE PROGRAM IS THE CONTINUING EDUCATION SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. MISSISSIPPI STATE VETERAN HOMES WILL PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION. THE SCHOLARSHIP WILL BE AVAILABLE TO ALL NURSING STAFF WHO ENROLL IN AN ACCREDITED NURSING PROGRAM. PART TWO OF MSVA’S PROGRAM IS THE SIGN-ON BONUS INCENTIVE PROGRAM. THE SIGN-ON BONUSES MAY RANGE FROM $500 -$5000 PER NURSE EMPLOYEE. THE EMPLOYEE RECEIVES THE FUNDS IN INTERVALS THROUGHOUT ONE YEAR. PART THREE IS THE STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS PROGRAM. AFTER A COMMITMENT OF AT LEAST TWO-YEAR FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT AT ONE OF THE MISSISSIPPI STATE VETERANS HOME, A STUDENT LOAN OF UP TO $25,000.00 CAN BE AWARDED PER NURSE EMPLOYEE.  $225,000

A TOTAL OF $434,750 WAS REQUESTED FOR THE SEVEN STATE VETERAN HOMES IN MISSOURI.  REQUEST WAS MADE TO IMPLEMENT A NURSE RETENTION PROGRAM FOR NURSING STAFF DEFINED AS THE FOLLOWING STATE OF MISSOURI JOB CLASSIFICATIONS: REGISTERED NURSE SPECIALIST/SUPERVISOR (RN), REGISTERED NURSE (RN), LICENSED PRACTICAL NURSE (LPN) OR SENIOR LPN, AND SUPPORT CARE ASSISTANT (CNA OR CMT). THE NURSING STAFF ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THREE RETENTION STIPEND PAYMENTS ON THE FOLLOWING SCHEDULE:$200 AT THE COMPLETION OF 3 MONTHS OF SUCCESSFUL FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT, $250 AT THE COMPLETION OF 6 MONTHS OF SUCCESSFUL FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT, $475 AT THE COMPLETION OF 12 MONTHS OF SUCCESSFUL FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT.

TOTAL REQUEST WAS $98,000 OF WHICH VA WILL PAY HALF OR $49,000 AND SVH WILL CONTRIBUTE THE OTHER $49,000.
$15,000 MVH HAS UTILIZED THE EMPLOYEE RETENTION SURVEY COMPONENT OF THE RETAIN SOFTWARE AT 15, 30, 60, 90 DAYS, PLUS 1 YEAR TO BETTER TRACK EMPLOYEE SATISFACTION ACROSS OUR STATE WIDE FOOTPRINT.
$80,500 FOR REFERRAL INCENTIVE PROGRAM 19 RNS AND 65 CNAS. CURRENT MVH EMPLOYEES WOULD BE ABLE TO EARN, BASED ON POSITION, A REFERRAL INCENTIVE UP TO $1,500 PER SUCCESSFULLY REFERRED CANDIDATE.  IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THE INCENTIVE, THE REFERRED CANDIDATE MUST SUCCESSFULLY INTERVIEW AND PASS ALL PRE-SCREENING MEASURES AND BACKGROUND CHECK. REFERRAL INCENTIVES WILL BE PAID ONE-THIRD AT HIRE AND THE BALANCE UPON CANDIDATE’S SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF 90 DAYS.
IN RECOGNITION OF SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THE FIRST 90 DAYS OF EMPLOYMENT, MVH WILL BE OFFERING EACH EMPLOYEE A RECOGNITION GIFT EACH VALUED AT $35.00 FOR A TOTAL OF $2,500.  ANY FUNDS RECEIVED UNDER THIS PART WOULD NOT SUPPORT ANY STANDARD EMPLOYEE BENEFITS, SUCH AS SALARY, HEALTH INSURANCE, OR RETIREMENT PLAN.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF 38 U.S.C. 1744, THIS PART SETS FORTH THE MECHANISM FOR A STATE TO OBTAIN PAYMENTS TO ASSIST A STATE VETERANS HOME (SVH) IN THE HIRING AND RETENTION OF NURSES FOR THE PURPOSE OF REDUCING NURSING SHORTAGES AT THAT SVH. IT IS A GRANT PROGRAM TO PROVIDE FUNDING ASSISTANCE FOR NO MORE THAN 3 YEARS THAT IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE SEQUENTIAL FOR USE OF HIRING AND RETENTION OF NURSES IN A STATE VETERANS HOME. NURSES CAN BE A REGISTERED NURSE, LICENSED PRACTICAL NURSE OR A CERTIFIED NURSE ASSISTANT.  THE SVH MUST DEMONSTRATE BY APPLICATION OF A NURSING SHORTAGE THAT IS DOCUMENTED BY CREDIBLE EVIDENCE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SVH RECORDS SHOWING NURSING VACANCIES, SVH RECORDS SHOWING NURSE OVERTIME USE, AND REPORTS DOCUMENTING THAT NURSES ARE DIFFICULT TO HIRE IN THE LOCAL AREA AND DIFFICULT TO RETAIN AS EMPLOYEES AT THE SVH. THE SVH MUST DEMONSTRATE THAT IT HAS AN EMPLOYEE INCENTIVE PROGRAM THAT CAN BE PUT INTO PLACE ON 10-1 OF THE FISCAL YEAR. PAYMENTS MAY NOT EXCEED 50 PERCENT OF THE COST OF THE EMPLOYEE INCENTIVE PROGRAM FOR THAT FISCAL YEAR AND MAY NOT EXCEED 2 PERCENT OF THE AMOUNT OF THE TOTAL PER DIEM PAYMENTS ESTIMATED BY VA TO BE MADE UNDER 38 U.S.C. 1741 TO THE STATE FOR THAT SVH DURING THAT FISCAL YEAR FOR ADULT DAY HEALTH CARE, DOMICILIARY CARE, HOSPITAL CARE, AND NURSING HOME CARE.
